availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, merchant. Native of England. Married to Catherine Ann Haldeman Escott in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on October 28, 1844. Father of Henry V. Escott, Robert Escott, Walter V. Escott, Ellen Escott, Emily Escott, John Escott, James Escott. Merchant in Louisville in 1850. Merchant in Louisville in 1860. Employed Catherine Halderman in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/District 2, p. 173A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 7, p. 484.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 9, p. 219A.
Find A Grave, "J.V. Escott (Mar. 28, 1861-Jan. 16, 1892)," Memorial #139783386, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/139783386 (accessed March 2, 2020).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482707, p. 184.
